headline: IFF price target raised to $80 from $70 at Argus
summary: Argus raised the firm’s price target on IFF (IFF) to $80 from $70 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm has a favorable view of the company’s innovative products and global reach, as well as their broad-based product applications across different markets, and while the company’s growth trajectory has been flattened by geopolitical developments and high raw material costs, Argus expects earnings to turnaround in the next few quarters, the analyst tells investors in a research note.Claim

headline: Potential Rate Cuts to Drive Momentum for International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF)
summary: International Flavors & Fragrances (NYSE:IFF) is one of the best Materials stocks to invest in according to Hedge Funds. Lauren Lieberman from Barclays reaffirmed her bullish view on International Flavors & Fragrances (NYSE:IFF). headline: Is International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF) Attractively Priced After Recent Share Price Rebound?
summary: If you are looking at International Flavors & Fragrances and wondering whether the current share price reflects its true worth, you are not alone. The stock last closed at US$72.16, with returns of 1.9% over the past week and 8.7% over the past month, while the 1 year return sits at a 14.6% decline and the 3 and 5 year returns are 29.2% and 28.3% declines respectively. Recent coverage has focused on how investors are reassessing companies in the materials and ingredients space, with...
